Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HG34 (Synthetic AMPs, homodimer, Halocidin analog, UCSS2a, XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence extension, amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 89.47% similar toHG1L=K: 21%, A: 16%, G=H: 11%. A lysine is added to the N-terminus of the wild type sequence. Warning: chain B sequence is the same as chain A.Chemical modification:  there is an intermolecular S-S bond between the two chains.Activity: active against S. aureus MRSA (MIC 4 ug/ml), B. subtilis (MIC 2 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. faecium strain CCARM 5028 anti-VRE (MIC 2 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes (MIC 2 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa MDRPA (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 2 ug/ml), K. oxytoca (MIC 2 ug/ml), C. freundii (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. enterica (MIC 2 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Shin YP, Park HJ, Shin SH, Lee YS, Park S, Jo S, Lee YH, Lee IH.2010
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial activity of a halocidin-derived peptide resistant to attacks by proteases.
